alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Russell, northern Cumberland, southwestern Adair and southeastern Metcalfe Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 533 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Burkesville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Russell, southeastern Metcalfe, northern Cumberland and southwestern Adair Counties, including the following locations... Waterview, Nell, Cofer, Weed, Breeding, Amandaville, Toria, Sparksville and Chance. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
